list-widget.empty: There are no items in this list.

user-profile.text: Your user profile has the following information:

client-form.access-token-no-timeout: Access tokens do not time out
client-form.access-token-timeout-help: Enter this time in seconds, minutes, or hours.
client-form.acr-values-help: Default Authentication Context Reference to request for this client
client-form.allow-introspection: Allow calls to the Introspection Endpoint?
client-form.client-id-help: Unique identifier. If you leave this blank it will be automatically generated.
client-form.contacts-help: List of contacts for administrators of this client.

crypto.a128cbc-hs256: Composite Authenticated Encryption algorithm using AES in Cipher Block Chaining (CBC) mode with PKCS #5 padding with an integrity calculation using HMAC SHA-256, using a 256 bit CMK (and 128 bit CEK)
crypto.a256cbc-hs512: Composite Authenticated Encryption algorithm using AES in CBC mode with PKCS #5 padding with an integrity calculation using HMAC SHA-512, using a 512 bit CMK (and 256 bit CEK)
crypto.a128kw: AES Key Wrap Algorithm using 128 bit keys
crypto.a256kw: AES Key Wrap Algorithm using 256 bit keys
crypto.dir: Direct use of a shared symmetric key as the Content Master Key (CMK) for the block encryption step
crypto.ecdh-es: Elliptic Curve Diffie-Hellman Ephemeral Static key agreement using the Concat KDF, with the agreed-upon key being used directly as the Content Master Key
crypto.ecdh-es-a128kw: Elliptic Curve Diffie-Hellman Ephemeral Static key agreement per ECDH-ES and Section 4.7, but where the agreed-upon key is used to wrap the Content Master Key (CMK) with the A128KW function
crypto.ecdh-es-a256kw: Elliptic Curve Diffie-Hellman Ephemeral Static key agreement per ECDH-ES and Section 4.7, but where the agreed-upon key is used to wrap the Content Master Key (CMK) with the A256KW function
crypto.rsa-oaep: RSAES using Optimal Asymmetric Encryption Padding (OAEP)

client-form.generate-new-secret-help: New secret will be generated when you click 'Save'
client-form.home-help: URL for the client's home page, will be displayed to the user
client-form.initiate-login-help: URL to initiate login on the client
client-form.jwk-set-help: URL for the client's JSON Web Key set (must be reachable by the server)
client-form.jwk-set-value-help: URL for the client's JSON Web Key set (must be reachable by the server)
client-form.logo-help: URL that points to a logo image, will be displayed on approval page
client-form.max-age-help: Default maximum session age before re-prompting
client-form.policy-help: URL for the Policy Statement of this client, will be displayed to the user
client-form.post-logout-help: URL to redirect the client to after a logout operation
client-form.redirect-uris-help: URIs that the client can be redirected to after the authorization page
client-form.claims-redirect-uris-help: URIs that the client can be redirected to after the claims gathering flow
client-form.refresh-tokens-issued: Refresh tokens are issued for this client
client-form.refresh-tokens-issued-help: This will add the offline_access scope to the client's scopes.
client-form.refresh-tokens-reused: Refresh tokens for this client are re-used
client-form.clear-access-tokens: Active access tokens are automatically revoked when the refresh token is used
client-form.refresh-tokens-no-expire: Refresh tokens do not time out
client-form.registration-token-error: There was a problem loading the registration access token for this client.
client-form.request-uri-help: URIs containing request objects used by this client
client-form.require-auth-time-label: Always require that the auth_time claim be sent in the id token
client-form.rotate-registration-token-confirm: Are you sure you want to rotate this client's registration token?
client-form.rotate-registration-token-error: There was a problem rotating the registration access token for this client.
client-form.scope-help: OAuth scopes this client is allowed to request
client-form.secret-symmetric-jwt: Client Secret via symmetrically-signed JWT assertion

signing.es256: ECDSA using P-256 curve and SHA-256 hash algorithm
signing.es384: ECDSA using P-384 curve and SHA-384 hash algorithm
signing.es512: ECDSA using P-512 curve and SHA-512 hash algorithm
signing.ps256: RSASSA-PSS using SHA-256 and MGF1 with SHA-256
signing.ps384: RSASSA-PSS using SHA-384 and MGF1 with SHA-384
signing.ps512: RSASSA-PSS using SHA-512 and MGF1 with SHA-512

client-form.terms-help: URL for the Terms of Service of this client, will be displayed to the user

client-table.allow-introspection-tooltip: This client can perform token introspection
client-table.confirm: Are you sure sure you would like to delete this client?
client-table.dynamically-registered-tooltip: This client was dynamically registered. Click to view registration access token
client-table.no-clients: There are no registered clients on this server.
client-table.no-matches: There are no clients that match your search criteria.

common.not-yet-implemented-content: The value of this field will be saved with the client, but the server does not currently process anything with it. Future versions of the server library will make use of this.

dynreg.edit-existing-help: Use this form to edit a previously-registered client. Paste in your client ID and registration access token to access the client.
dynreg.invalid-access-token: Invalid client or registration access token.
dynreg.new-client-help: Use this form to register a new client with the authorization server. You will be given a client ID and a registration access token to manage your client.
dynreg.warning: Warning! You MUST protect your Client ID, Client Secret (if provided), and your Registration Access Token. If you lose your Client ID or Registration Access Token, you will no longer have access to your client's registration records and you will need to register a new client.
dynreg.will-be-generated: Will be generated by the server when the client is saved

grant-table.active-tokens: Number of currently active access tokens
grant-table.no-sites: You have not approved any sites.
grant-table.no-whitelisted: You have not accessed any whitelisted sites.
grant-table.pre-approved: These are sites that have been pre-approved by an administrator.
grant-table.text: These are sites you have approved manually. If the same site asks for the same access in the future, it will be granted without prompting.
grant-table.whitelist-note: NOTE: If you revoke them here, they will automatically be re-approved on your next visit wthout prompting.
grant-table.whitelisted-site: This site was whitelisted by an adminstrator

rsreg.edit-existing-help: Use this form to edit a previously-registered resource. Paste in your client ID and registration access token to access the client.
rsreg.invalid-access-token: Invalid client or registration access token.
rsreg.new-client-help: Use this form to register a new resource with the authorization server. You will be given a client ID and a registration access token to manage your resource.
rsreg.will-be-generated: Will be generated by the server when the resource is saved
rsreg.warning: Warning! You MUST protect your Client ID, Client Secret (if provided), and your Registration Access Token. If you lose your Client ID or Registration Access Token, you will no longer have access to your client's registration records and you will need to register a new client.

client-form.scope-help: Scopes that this resource will be able to introspect tokens for.

system-scope-form.default-help: Newly-created clients get this scope by default?
system-scope-form.restricted-help: Restricted scopes are only usable by system administrators and are unavailable to dynamically registered clients and protected resources
system-scope-form.structured-help: Is the scope structured with structured values like base:extension?
system-scope-form.structured-param-help: Human-readable description of the structured parameter

system-scope-table.confirm: Are you sure sure you would like to delete this scope? Clients that have this scope will still be able to ask for it.
system-scope-table.text: There are no system scopes defined. Clients may still have custom scopes.
system-scope-table.tooltip-restricted: This scope can be used only by adminisrtators. It is not available for dynamic registration.
system-scope-table.tooltip-default: This scope is automatically assigned to newly registered clients.

token-table.associated-id: This access token was issued with an associated ID token.
token-table.associated-refresh: This access token was issued with an associated refresh token.
token-table.click-to-display: Click to display full token value
token-table.confirm: Are you sure sure you would like to revoke this token?
token-table.confirm-refresh: Are you sure sure you would like to revoke this refresh token and its associated access tokens?
token-table.no-access: There are no active access tokens.
token-table.no-refresh: There are no active refresh tokens.
token-table.text: Access tokens are usually short-lived and provide clients with access to specific resources. ID Tokens are specialized access tokens to facilitate log on using OpenID Connect.
token-table.text-refresh: Refresh tokens are usually long-lived and provide clients with the ability to get new access tokens without end-user involvement.

whitelist.confirm: Are you sure you want to delete this whitelist entry?

whitelist-form.scope-help: List of scopes that will be automatically approved when this client makes a request

whitelist-table.no-sites: There are no whitelisted sites. Use the whitelist button on the client management page to create one.

blacklist.text: Blacklisted URIs cannot be used as redirect URIs by any registered clients, whether in the admin interface or in dynamic registration.
blacklist.empty: There are no blacklisted URIs on this server.

copyright: Powered by MITREid Connect {0} © 2016 The MITRE Corporation and MIT Internet Trust Consortium..

about.title: About
about.body:
This OpenID Connect service is built from the MITREid Connect Open Source project, from The MITRE Corporation and the MIT Internet Trust Consortium.

More information about the project can be found at MITREid Connect on GitHub. There, you can submit bug reports, give feedback, or even contribute code patches for additional features you'd like to see.

statistics.title: Statistics
statistics.number_users: Number of users: {0}

welcome.title: Welcome!
welcome.body:
OpenID Connect is an internet-scale federated identity protocol built on top of the OAuth2 authorization framework. OpenID Connect lets you log into a remote site using your identity without exposing your credentials, like a username and password.

Learn more »

about.title: About
about.body: This OpenID Connect service is built from the MITREid Connect Open Source project, from The MITRE Corporation and the MIT Internet Trust Consortium.

contact.title: Contact
contact.body:
For more information or support, contact the administrators of this system.

Email »

statistics.title: Current Statistics
statistics.number_users: Number of users: {0}

contact.title: Contact
contact.body: To report bugs with the MITREid Connect software itself, use the GitHub issue tracker. For problems relating to this server, contact the server's administrator.

approve.title: Approve Access
approve.dynamically_registered: This client was dynamically registered {0}.

message.none: It has never been approved previously.
message.singular: It has been approved {0} time previously.
message.plural: It has been approved {0} times previously.

approve.no_redirect_uri: This client does not have any redirect URIs registered and someone could be using a malicious URI here.
approve.redirect_uri: You will be redirected to the following page if you click Approve: {0}
approve.pairwise: This client uses a pairwise identifier, which makes it more difficult to correlate your identity between sites.
approve.no_scopes: This client does not have any scopes registered and is therefore allowed to request any scopes available on the system. Proceed with caution.

remember.title: Remember this decision
remember.until_revoke: remember this decision until I revoke it
remember.one_hour: remember this decision for one hour

error.title: Error
error.message: There was an error processing your request. The server''s message was:

login.error: The system was unable to log you in. Please try again.
